New Records: Marcus Semien hit a two-run triple and three-run homer, Corey Seager hit another long home run, and the Texas Rangers built a 10-run lead by the third inning, the first team in World Series history with consecutive five-run innings.
Key Match Events: Marcus Semien's two-run triple and three-run homer powered Texas to a 10-run lead by the third inning
Corey Seager hit another long home run
The Rangers built a 10-run lead by the third inning, the first team in World Series history with consecutive five-run innings
Lourdes Gurriel Jr. hit a three-run homer in the eighth against Chris Stratton
Pre-Game Insights: Adolis García gathered Texas Rangers hitters in a clubhouse side room and told them his World Series was over, Max Scherzer was finished, too, injuries costing the American League champions their top slugger and potential Game 7 starting pitcher.
Post-Match Reflections: Texas improved to a record 10-0 on the road this postseason and closed within one win of the first title in the 63-season history of a franchise that started as the expansion Washington Senators in 1961.
Forty-two of 49 previous teams to take 3-1 leads have gone on to win the World Series.
Seager and Semien, All-Star middle infielders signed as free agents for $500 million combined before the 2022 season, have six RBIs each in the Series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rangers' families gathered with their children at the team hotel at 10 a.m. About two dozen children were in costume, with Jankowski's two sons and daughter dressed as a falcon, Spider-Man and Bingo from 'Bluey'.
Ketel Marte had two hits, extending his record postseason hitting streak to 20 games.
Andrew Heaney, a 32-year-old lefty with his fifth big league team, earned the win by allowing four hits in five innings.
Others: The game was played at Chase Field, where the roof was open for the second straight night and some fans arrived in Halloween costumes.
Josh Jung doubled off opener Joe Mantiply leading off the second and in came Castro, who gave up García's winning homer in the 11th inning of Game 1.
Jankowski's two sons and daughter were dressed as a falcon, Spider-Man and Bingo from 'Bluey'.
